availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Burras. Father of Rachel Burras, Marshal Burras, Louisa Burras, and Elizabeth Burras. Farmer in Carter County in 1860. Private in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from July 6, 1863 to December 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, p. 66.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 430.
Find A Grave, "Sanders Burras (1826-May 4, 1904)," Memorial #69970640, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/69970640 (accessed May 7, 2018).
